dt: {bc}directed toward the will or toward the mind specifically in its conative function

shortdef: directed toward the will or toward the mind specifically in its conative function

dt: {bc}the occasion when the mental atmosphere is most certain to be favorable to the full effect of an action or event

shortdef: the occasion when the mental atmosphere is most certain to be favorable to the full effect of an action or event

dt: {bc}things that are done to make someone (such as an enemy or opponent) become less confident or to feel hopeless, afraid, etc.

dt.t: The army used radio broadcasts into enemy territory as a form of {it}psychological warfare{/it}.

shortdef: things that are done to make someone (such as an enemy or opponent) become less confident or to feel hopeless, afraid, etc.
